description: From Middle English ferny; equivalent to fern +‎ -y.

entries.meaning: Resembling or characteristic of a fern, in appearance, smell, etc.
Covered in or filled with ferns; flanked or surrounded by ferns.
examples: And from the bush there came the sound of little streams flowing, quickly, lightly, slipping between the smooth stones, gushing into ferny basins and out again; and there was the splashing of big drops on large leaves  […]
